001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
005import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.WorldMapGenerator;
006import squidpony.squidmath.DiverRNG;
007import squidpony.squidmath.NumberTools;
008
009/**
010 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 9/6/2019.
011 */
012@SuppressWarnings("NumericOverflow")
013public class WorldMapView {
014    protected int width, height;
015    protected float[][] colorMap;
016    protected WorldMapGenerator world;
017    protected WorldMapGenerator.DetailedBiomeMapper biomeMapper;
018
019    public int getWidth() {
020        return width;
021    }
022
023    public int getHeight() {
024        return height;
025    }
026
027    public float[][] getColorMap() {
028        return colorMap;
029    }
030
031    public WorldMapGenerator.DetailedBiomeMapper getBiomeMapper() {
032        return biomeMapper;
033    }
034
035    public void setBiomeMapper(WorldMapGenerator.DetailedBiomeMapper biomeMapper) {
036        this.biomeMapper = biomeMapper;
037    }
038
039    public WorldMapGenerator getWorld() {
040        return world;
041    }
042
043    public void setWorld(WorldMapGenerator world) {
044        this.world = world;
045        if(this.width != world.width || this.height != world.height)
046        {
047            width = world.width;
048            height = world.height;
049            colorMap = new float[width][height];
050        }
051    }
052
053    public WorldMapView(WorldMapGenerator worldMapGenerator)
054    {
055        world = worldMapGenerator == null ? new WorldMapGenerator.LocalMap() : worldMapGenerator;
056        width = world.width;
057        height = world.height;
058        colorMap = new float[width][height];
059        this.biomeMapper = new WorldMapGenerator.DetailedBiomeMapper();
060        initialize();
061    }
062    
063    public WorldMapView(long seed, int width, int height)
064    {
065        this(new WorldMapGenerator.LocalMap(seed, width, height));
066    }
067    
068    public static final int
069            Desert                 = 0 ,
070            Savanna                = 1 ,
071            TropicalRainforest     = 2 ,
072            Grassland              = 3 ,
073            Woodland               = 4 ,
074            SeasonalForest         = 5 ,
075            TemperateRainforest    = 6 ,
076            BorealForest           = 7 ,
077            Tundra                 = 8 ,
078            Ice                    = 9 ,
079            Beach                  = 10,
080            Rocky                  = 11,
081            Shallow                = 12,
082            Ocean                  = 13,
083            Empty                  = 14;
084
085    public static float iceColor = SColor.floatGet(240 << 24 | 248 << 16 | 255 << 8 | 255);
086    public static float desertColor = SColor.floatGet(248 << 24 | 229 << 16 | 180 << 8 | 255);
087    public static float savannaColor = SColor.floatGet(190 << 24 | 195 << 16 | 105 << 8 | 255);
088    public static float tropicalRainforestColor = SColor.floatGet(40 << 24 | 100 << 16 | 15 << 8 | 255);
089    public static float tundraColor = SColor.floatGet(151 << 24 | 175 << 16 | 159 << 8 | 255);
090    public static float temperateRainforestColor = SColor.floatGet(54 << 24 | 113 << 16 | 60 << 8 | 255);
091    public static float grasslandColor = SColor.floatGet(145 << 24 | 165 << 16 | 100 << 8 | 255);
092    public static float seasonalForestColor = SColor.floatGet(70 << 24 | 120 << 16 | 35 << 8 | 255);
093    public static float borealForestColor = SColor.floatGet(75 << 24 | 105 << 16 | 45 << 8 | 255);
094    public static float woodlandColor = SColor.floatGet(92 << 24 | 160 << 16 | 70 << 8 | 255);
095    public static float rockyColor = SColor.floatGet(171 << 24 | 175 << 16 | 145 << 8 | 255);
096    public static float beachColor = SColor.floatGet(255 << 24 | 235 << 16 | 180 << 8 | 255);
097    public static float emptyColor = SColor.floatGet(34 << 24 | 32 << 16 | 52 << 8 | 255);
098
099    // water colors
100    public static float deepColor = SColor.floatGet(0 << 24 | 42 << 16 | 88 << 8 | 255);
101    public static float shallowColor = SColor.floatGet(20 << 24 | 145 << 16 | 197 << 8 | 255);
102    public static float foamColor = SColor.floatGet(61 << 24 | 162 << 16 | 215 << 8 | 255);
103
104    protected float[] biomeColors = {
105            desertColor,
106            savannaColor,
107            tropicalRainforestColor,
108            grasslandColor,
109            woodlandColor,
110            seasonalForestColor,
111            temperateRainforestColor,
112            borealForestColor,
113            tundraColor,
114            iceColor,
115            beachColor,
116            rockyColor,
117            shallowColor,
118            deepColor,
119            emptyColor
120    };
121
122    public final static float[] BIOME_TABLE = {
123            //COLDEST   //COLDER      //COLD               //HOT                     //HOTTER                 //HOTTEST
124            Ice+0.85f,  Ice+0.65f,    Grassland+0.9f,      Desert+0.75f,             Desert+0.8f,             Desert+0.85f,            //DRYEST
125            Ice+0.7f,   Tundra+0.9f,  Grassland+0.6f,      Grassland+0.3f,           Desert+0.65f,            Desert+0.7f,             //DRYER
126            Ice+0.55f,  Tundra+0.7f,  Woodland+0.4f,       Woodland+0.6f,            Savanna+0.8f,            Desert+0.6f,             //DRY
127            Ice+0.4f,   Tundra+0.5f,  SeasonalForest+0.3f, SeasonalForest+0.5f,      Savanna+0.6f,            Savanna+0.4f,            //WET
128            Ice+0.2f,   Tundra+0.3f,  BorealForest+0.35f,  TemperateRainforest+0.4f, TropicalRainforest+0.6f, Savanna+0.2f,            //WETTER
129            Ice+0.0f,   BorealForest, BorealForest+0.15f,  TemperateRainforest+0.2f, TropicalRainforest+0.4f, TropicalRainforest+0.2f, //WETTEST
130            Rocky+0.9f, Rocky+0.6f,   Beach+0.4f,          Beach+0.55f,              Beach+0.75f,             Beach+0.9f,              //COASTS
131            Ice+0.3f,   Shallow+0.9f, Shallow+0.75f,       Shallow+0.6f,             Shallow+0.5f,            Shallow+0.4f,            //RIVERS
132            Ice+0.2f,   Shallow+0.9f, Shallow+0.65f,       Shallow+0.5f,             Shallow+0.4f,            Shallow+0.3f,            //LAKES
133            Ocean+0.9f, Ocean+0.75f,  Ocean+0.6f,          Ocean+0.45f,              Ocean+0.3f,              Ocean+0.15f,             //OCEANS
134            Empty                                                                                                                      //SPACE
135    };
136    public final float[] BIOME_COLOR_TABLE = new float[61], BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE = new float[61];
137    
138    public void initialize()
139    {
140        initialize(0f, 0f, 0f, 1f);
141    }
142    
143    public void initialize(float hue, float saturation, float brightness, float contrast)
144    {
145        float b, diff;
146        for (int i = 0; i < 60; i++) {
147            b = BIOME_TABLE[i];
148            diff = ((b % 1.0f) - 0.48f) * 0.27f * contrast;
149            BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[i] = b = SColor.toEditedFloat((diff >= 0)
150                    ? SColor.lightenFloat(biomeColors[(int)b], diff)
151                    : SColor.darkenFloat(biomeColors[(int)b], -diff), hue, saturation, brightness, 0f);
152            BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[i] = SColor.darkenFloat(b, 0.08f);
153        }
154        BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[60] = BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[60] = emptyColor;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Initializes the colors to use for each biome (these are almost always mixed with other biome colors in practice).
159     * Each parameter may be null to use the default for an Earth-like world; otherwise it should be a libGDX
160     * {@link Color} or some subclass, like {@link SColor}. All non-null parameters should probably be fully opaque,
161     * except {@code emptyColor}, which is only used for world maps that show empty space (like a globe, as produced by
162     * {@link WorldMapGenerator.RotatingSpaceMap}).
163     * @param desertColor hot, dry, barren land; may be sandy, but many real-world deserts don't have much sand
164     * @param savannaColor hot, mostly-dry land with some parched vegetation; also called scrub or chaparral
165     * @param tropicalRainforestColor hot, extremely wet forests with dense rich vegetation
166     * @param grasslandColor prairies that are dry and usually wind-swept, but not especially hot or cold
167     * @param woodlandColor part-way between a prairie and a forest; not especially hot or cold
168     * @param seasonalForestColor forest that becomes barren in winter (deciduous trees); not especially hot or cold
169     * @param temperateRainforestColor forest that tends to be slightly warm but very wet
170     * @param borealForestColor forest that tends to be cold and very wet
171     * @param tundraColor very cold plains that still have some low-lying vegetation; also called taiga 
172     * @param iceColor cold barren land covered in permafrost; also used for rivers and lakes that are frozen
173     * @param beachColor sandy or otherwise light-colored shorelines; here, these are more common in warmer places
174     * @param rockyColor rocky or otherwise rugged shorelines; here, these are more common in colder places
175     * @param shallowColor the color of very shallow water; will be mixed with {@code deepColor} to get most ocean colors
176     * @param deepColor the color of very deep water; will be mixed with {@code shallowColor} to get most ocean colors
177     * @param emptyColor the color used for empty space off the edge of the world map; may be transparent
178     */
179    public void initialize(
180            Color desertColor,
181            Color savannaColor,
182            Color tropicalRainforestColor,
183            Color grasslandColor,
184            Color woodlandColor,
185            Color seasonalForestColor,
186            Color temperateRainforestColor,
187            Color borealForestColor,
188            Color tundraColor,
189            Color iceColor,
190            Color beachColor,
191            Color rockyColor,
192            Color shallowColor,
193            Color deepColor,
194            Color emptyColor
195    )
196    {
197        biomeColors[ 0] = desertColor == null ? WorldMapView.desertColor : desertColor.toFloatBits();
198        biomeColors[ 1] = savannaColor == null ? WorldMapView.savannaColor : savannaColor.toFloatBits();
199        biomeColors[ 2] = tropicalRainforestColor == null ? WorldMapView.tropicalRainforestColor : tropicalRainforestColor.toFloatBits();
200        biomeColors[ 3] = grasslandColor == null ? WorldMapView.grasslandColor : grasslandColor.toFloatBits();
201        biomeColors[ 4] = woodlandColor == null ? WorldMapView.woodlandColor : woodlandColor.toFloatBits();
202        biomeColors[ 5] = seasonalForestColor == null ? WorldMapView.seasonalForestColor : seasonalForestColor.toFloatBits();
203        biomeColors[ 6] = temperateRainforestColor == null ? WorldMapView.temperateRainforestColor : temperateRainforestColor.toFloatBits();
204        biomeColors[ 7] = borealForestColor == null ? WorldMapView.borealForestColor : borealForestColor.toFloatBits();
205        biomeColors[ 8] = tundraColor == null ? WorldMapView.tundraColor : tundraColor.toFloatBits();
206        biomeColors[ 9] = iceColor == null ? WorldMapView.iceColor : iceColor.toFloatBits();
207        biomeColors[10] = beachColor == null ? WorldMapView.beachColor : beachColor.toFloatBits();
208        biomeColors[11] = rockyColor == null ? WorldMapView.rockyColor : rockyColor.toFloatBits();
209        biomeColors[12] = shallowColor == null ? WorldMapView.shallowColor : shallowColor.toFloatBits();
210        biomeColors[13] = deepColor == null ? WorldMapView.deepColor : deepColor.toFloatBits();
211        biomeColors[14] = emptyColor == null ? WorldMapView.emptyColor : emptyColor.toFloatBits();
212        float b, diff;
213        for (int i = 0; i < 60; i++) {
214            b = BIOME_TABLE[i];
215            diff = ((b % 1.0f) - 0.48f) * 0.27f;
216            BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[i] = b = (diff >= 0)
217                    ? SColor.lightenFloat(biomeColors[(int)b], diff)
218                    : SColor.darkenFloat(biomeColors[(int)b], -diff);
219            BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[i] = SColor.darkenFloat(b, 0.08f);
220        }
221        BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[60] = BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[60] = biomeColors[14];
222        biomeColors[ 0] = WorldMapView.desertColor;
223        biomeColors[ 1] = WorldMapView.savannaColor;
224        biomeColors[ 2] = WorldMapView.tropicalRainforestColor;
225        biomeColors[ 3] = WorldMapView.grasslandColor;
226        biomeColors[ 4] = WorldMapView.woodlandColor;
227        biomeColors[ 5] = WorldMapView.seasonalForestColor;
228        biomeColors[ 6] = WorldMapView.temperateRainforestColor;
229        biomeColors[ 7] = WorldMapView.borealForestColor;
230        biomeColors[ 8] = WorldMapView.tundraColor;
231        biomeColors[ 9] = WorldMapView.iceColor;
232        biomeColors[10] = WorldMapView.beachColor;
233        biomeColors[11] = WorldMapView.rockyColor;
234        biomeColors[12] = WorldMapView.shallowColor;
235        biomeColors[13] = WorldMapView.deepColor;
236        biomeColors[14] = WorldMapView.emptyColor;
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * Initializes the colors to use in some combination for all biomes, without regard for what the biome really is.
241     * There should be at least one packed float color given in similarColors, but there can be many of them.
242     * @param similarColors an array or vararg of packed float colors with at least one element
243     */
244    public void match(
245            float... similarColors
246    )
247    {
248        for (int i = 0; i < 14; i++) {
249            biomeColors[i] = SColor.lerpFloatColors(similarColors[i % similarColors.length], similarColors[(i * 5 + 3) % similarColors.length], 0.5f);
250        }
251        biomeColors[14] = WorldMapView.emptyColor;
252        float b, diff;
253        for (int i = 0; i < 60; i++) {
254            b = BIOME_TABLE[i];
255            diff = ((b % 1.0f) - 0.48f) * 0.27f;
256            BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[i] = b = (diff >= 0)
257                    ? SColor.lightenFloat(biomeColors[(int)b], diff)
258                    : SColor.darkenFloat(biomeColors[(int)b], -diff);
259            BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[i] = SColor.darkenFloat(b, 0.08f);
260        }
261        BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[60] = BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[60] = biomeColors[14];
262        biomeColors[ 0] = WorldMapView.desertColor;
263        biomeColors[ 1] = WorldMapView.savannaColor;
264        biomeColors[ 2] = WorldMapView.tropicalRainforestColor;
265        biomeColors[ 3] = WorldMapView.grasslandColor;
266        biomeColors[ 4] = WorldMapView.woodlandColor;
267        biomeColors[ 5] = WorldMapView.seasonalForestColor;
268        biomeColors[ 6] = WorldMapView.temperateRainforestColor;
269        biomeColors[ 7] = WorldMapView.borealForestColor;
270        biomeColors[ 8] = WorldMapView.tundraColor;
271        biomeColors[ 9] = WorldMapView.iceColor;
272        biomeColors[10] = WorldMapView.beachColor;
273        biomeColors[11] = WorldMapView.rockyColor;
274        biomeColors[12] = WorldMapView.shallowColor;
275        biomeColors[13] = WorldMapView.deepColor;
276        biomeColors[14] = WorldMapView.emptyColor;
277    }
278
279    public void generate()
280    {
281//        generate(world.seedA, world.seedB, 0.9 + NumberTools.formCurvedDouble((world.seedA ^ 0x123456789ABCDL) * 0x12345689ABL ^ world.seedB) * 0.15,
282//                DiverRNG.determineDouble(world.seedB * 0x12345L + 0x54321L ^ world.seedA) * 0.2 + 1.0);
283        generate(world.seedA, world.seedB, 1.0 + NumberTools.formCurvedDouble((world.seedA ^ 0x123456789ABCDL) * 0x12345689ABL ^ world.seedB) * 0.25,
284                DiverRNG.determineDouble(world.seedB * 0x12345L + 0x54321L ^ world.seedA) * 0.375 + 1.0625);
285    }
286    public void generate(double landMod, double heatMod)
287    {
288        generate(world.seedA, world.seedB, landMod, heatMod);
289    }
290    
291    public void generate(int seedA, int seedB, double landMod, double heatMod) {
292        long seed = (long) seedB << 32 | (seedA & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
293        world.generate(landMod, heatMod, seed);
294        biomeMapper.makeBiomes(world);
295    }
296    public float[][] show()
297    {
298        int hc, tc, bc;
299        final int[][] heightCodeData = world.heightCodeData;
300        double[][] heightData = world.heightData;
301        int[][] heatCodeData = biomeMapper.heatCodeData;
302        int[][] biomeCodeData = biomeMapper.biomeCodeData;
303
304        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
305            PER_CELL:
306            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
307                hc = heightCodeData[x][y];
308                if(hc == 1000)
309                {
310                    colorMap[x][y] = emptyColor;
311                    continue;
312                }
313                tc = heatCodeData[x][y];
314                bc = biomeCodeData[x][y];
315                if(tc == 0)
316                {
317                    switch (hc)
318                    {
319                        case 0:
320                        case 1:
321                        case 2:
322                        case 3:
323                            colorMap[x][y] = SColor.lerpFloatColors(BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[50], BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[12],
324                                    (float) ((heightData[x][y] - -1.0) / (WorldMapGenerator.sandLower - -1.0)));
325                            continue PER_CELL;
326                        case 4:
327                            colorMap[x][y] = SColor.lerpFloatColors(BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[0], BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[12],
328                                    (float) ((heightData[x][y] - WorldMapGenerator.sandLower) / (WorldMapGenerator.sandUpper - WorldMapGenerator.sandLower)));
329                            continue PER_CELL;
330                    }
331                }
332                switch (hc) {
333                    case 0:
334                    case 1:
335                    case 2:
336                    case 3:
337                        colorMap[x][y] = SColor.lerpFloatColors(
338                                BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[56], BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[43],
339                                (MathUtils.clamp((float) (((heightData[x][y] + 0.06) * 8.0) / (WorldMapGenerator.sandLower + 1.0)), 0f, 1f)));
340                        break;
341                    default:
342                        colorMap[x][y] = SColor.lerpFloatColors(BIOME_COLOR_TABLE[biomeMapper.extractPartB(bc)],
343                                BIOME_DARK_COLOR_TABLE[biomeMapper.extractPartA(bc)], biomeMapper.extractMixAmount(bc));
344                }
345            }
346        }
347        
348        return colorMap;
349    }
350}
